Great question. Good and Bad are the labels, we use to identify Actions, more importantly, Decisions. This process of labelling is largely an analyzation of the sequence of actions that are triggered by the Decision and their impact on the physical world. Good is good because the people impacted by the Decision and thereby, the action are benefitted either tangibly or intangibly, no matter the degree of it's significance. Bad is bad because the sequence of Actions harm one or more person(s) and/or thing(s). Good luck understanding what I just said. Caio

because it says so in the dictionary. I assume what you mean is: how does a society determines what is good and what is bad? By looking at possible benefits/consequences. By checking whether this is how you yourself would want to be treated. By experiencing the ‘bad’ and defining it as bad.

How does “it” make you feel? Does “it” benefit or help yourself and/or others? Probably good…Does “it” harm or hurt, directly or indirectly, yourself and/or others? Probably bad…Is “it” enjoyable and fun? Maybe good…Can “it” get you into trouble? Maybe bad…We all make mistakes in life, it’s part of the learning process in my opinion. But it’s never too late to make some changes and try our best at making responsible choices that will benefit ourselves and others.

We call actions good because we believe they are the right thing to do, and we call them bad if we believe they should not be done. There is no absolute good and no absolute bad, just as there is no absolute right and no absolute wrong. Right and wrong is only meaningful in connection with the goals you have in mind. For example, according to the morals of the bible, Abrahams agreement to sacrifice his son was “good” and “right”, because the only moral goal the bible has in mind ist the satisfaction of a despotic, selfish and cruel invisible “friend”. Any morality centered on humanity would consider such a behaviour aweful and condemnable.

Put it another way: Why is beautiful, beautiful and ugly, ugly? It all depends on one’s perspective. Good and bad are opinions and judgements by (the members of) the society just as beauty and ugliness are.
